We left a cake that we had bought from Town out, sealed in its box overnight on the top of the chest of drawers and in the morning it was covered with ants who were taking the cake apart and carrying it away down the legs of the chest and disappearing under the floor. There was a free to use computer for internet in the lobby, which was useful for checking flights etc or getting more details of the area. $5 a day for parking is a lot less than most other hotels in the area and when you take into account the cost of the staying at this hotel and that breakfast is included we thought it OK. Altogether we thought the hotel good value and would stay there again. Just a few notes on San Diego, you need to hire a car, do not visit Sea World especially if you have been to the one in Florida as its very poor and very expensive to get in. Do visit Point Loma for the views. I hope you found this review of some help.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Pamela A
Reviews.Content: I had both my wedding and wedding reception at the Bay Club Hotel and Marina this past weekend (Oct 7-9) and could not have been more pleased with how the entire affair turned out. Most of my guests came in from out of town so we had them all stay at the hotel. It was a great decision because they all enjoyed themselves and had wonderful things to say about the hotel. Everyone loved being so close to everything (downtown San Diego, the San Diego Zoo, Sea World) and they loved their rooms. They had incredible views from both sides of the hotel and received great service from the hotel staff. We had wonderful weather that weekend so many of them got a chance to relax by the beautiful pool and patio in the back of the hotel. They all raved about the food and the wonderful (complimentary) breakfast buffet each morning. As for my wedding and reception I worked with Tammy Garbini, Director of Sales and Marketing and she took care of everything right down to the last detail. We decided to have the ceremony outside on the back patio which was absolutely gorgeous against the incredible views of the marina. As luck would have it the weather was spectacular so we truly got married in paradise! After the wedding Tammy arranged for a nice cocktail hour so our guests could mingle and enjoy drinks and hor d'oeuvres. It was the perfect touch to lead into the reception. The food at our wedding reception was delicious and the service from the hotel staff was fantastic. They took great care of not just our bridal party but every single one of our guests. Absolutely everyone felt attended to and it gave such a warm and personal feeling to the entire affair. I didn't have to worry about a thing - Tammy and her incredible staff handled everything for me so I could enjoy my day and spend every minute with my guests. We absolutely loved it and had a wonderful time! The next time I have a big party to do I won't hestitate to have it at the Bay Club and Marina. Or even a nice weekend with friends … We had a great experience and are looking forward to going back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travelor146
Reviews.Content: When we showed up for our reservation we were so surprised to find an awesome place. Fantastic view, we had the harbor, great restaurant etc. Our next stop was to be the del Coronado and we even tried to cancel those reservations to stay here longer. Great deals available on line too. The fun part was sitting outside at night and listening to the bands playing next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but everything else is nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Arjan_W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its location and the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. Boy oh boy were our expectations not met! The service that a lot of people commented so fondly of was in our case non-existent. From the minute we arrived we encountered nothing but Pan Am smiles without any genuine interest in the guests. The atmosphere in the hotel was far from the advertised Hawaiian feel with even an annoyingly outdated pianist puppet behind the piano. The place felt worn out and outdated. The rooms, beds and breakfast were okay but nothing special. The parking fee of $5 a day is a disgrace given the already overpriced rates. Their argument that properties in the vicinity charge $15 or more a day was too annoying for words. The happy hour was a total joke and the complimentary 'hors d'oeuvres' were nothing more than a messy plate of nachos.. and that for several days in row! The only value of this hotel is its location on Shelter Island. Nothing more, nothing less. If you are looking for a "home away from home" hotel with value for your dollars then keep on driving :) We won't be back and neither will we recommend this property to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to view the harbor or marina, very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: bootleg711
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times, at 2 different times of year. High and low season (August and January). Rooms in August were expensive (210/nite), but this was in 2007, whereas in January 2011 we got 99/nite. Regardless, we will never stay anywhere else in San Diego. The Bay Club is convenient to everything San Diego has to offer, In N Out Burger, the Zoo, Cabrillo, and the 5 Freeway. It's even close to the airport without being annoying. I also find being across from NAS Coronado Island a treat because we are greeting by Blackhawks and Aircraft Carriers on a daily basis! The Breakfast buffet is great, the staff is tremendous and changed our room the first time we were there in 2007 to satisfy my wife. Overall, we can't wait for our next trip to San Diego, and we'll staying at the Bay Club for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice view - but old”
Reviews.Author: jazzinj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, the night before we were heading home after a week's stay in Oceanside. We wanted to be closer to the airport, and also wanted to try out a new location in San Diego. I booked the Hawaiian package - I can't remember exactly what it was called, but it included two free drinks in the lounge, and a welcome platter of fruit and cookies, and parking was also included in the price. We didn't get the free drinks because the lounge closed early and we didn't make it in time. The platter was delivered just as we were heading to the room after check-in, by the same lady that checked us in. Check in service was excellent, the lady was very friendly and welcoming. The room was clean and bright, but smelled kind of old and musty. It was pretty old, old carpets, old carpets in the hallway, had the wood 70's look to it. There is a small bar area with a fridge and counter and sink, where the coffee maker is. The bathroom was clean and functional, but lighting was quite dim, the fan made a lot of noise, and again it was pretty old. We had a room with two queen beds. The view from the balcony was very nice, you can see the water (we had a bay view), the patio window was old and rickety, and the balcony was also old. We parked outside just below our balcony (we were on the second floor). It did look and feel like a Polynesian theme, it reminded me of the old apartment time share units in Waikiki, same era (only well kept compared to the ones in Waikiki). The lady at the front desk recommended a restaurant nearby, she said it was a 20 minute walk but it certainly was not, we walked 20 minutes and were in the middle of nowhere, then decided to go back and get the car - it was definitely a short drive, though. The surrounding area was very nice, we went for a walk along the path by the water, walked onto a pier where a few people were fishing, played in the playground nearby, watched some birds. It's a beautiful, relaxing area - not much around other than that, though. It's definitely a marina place, you drive through a lot of boat related businesses before you get to the hotels by the water. The walls are thin - there was a baby crying in the next room and it kept me up until late and then woke me up early in the morning. Luckily my kids and husband are heavy sleepers and manage to sleep right through it. I'm not a light sleeper, either, but it woke me up. We went down to the free breakfast, and yes, there are hot choices, and we did manage to eat something, but it wasn't very good. I had to ask for a coffee refill a few times before I got one. The servers looked rushed and harried even though it was a buffet and "seat yourself" style service. They still had to clear the tables and serve drinks. Overall I would say it was a pleasant stay, I wasn't expecting the Hilton or anything like that, so it met my expectations - I would suggest they upgrade the place a bit, though. It was fine for a one night stay, I probably wouldn't spend the week there, and I would probably not stay there again - now that we've tried the Shelter Island area, it's nice, but there's not much around, there are better locations to stay as a home base in San Diego. If I were to stay in that area again, I'd probably try the other, newer hotels nearby. It was okay value for what I paid, I think that I could have found a nicer place cheaper but it was probably more costly due to its proximity to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KimD2009
Reviews.Content: We (My husband 2 teenage sons and I) recently stayed at the Bay Club for 3 nights while visiting San Diego. We had a Marina View room which had a great view over the marina. The room was clean and comfortable and a good size. Breakfast was included in the rate and comprised juice, cereal, hot food and tea and coffee. We ate in the hotel restaurant one night and the food and service were fine. The hotel was about 10 mins drive from SeaWorld and about 15mins from the zoo. It was also close to Point Loma lookout and about a 20 min drive round to Coronado. Check in was easy and the reception staff pleasant. The only minor -ve was morning breakfasts where the same waitress every morning seemed to be on a timer to clear plates, reset tables fairly haphazardly and generally looked like working there was a chore for her. Other than that it was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't reserve this from internet”
Reviews.Author: Jack N
Reviews.Content: Called this hotel to reserve and spoke to Aaron, wanted to reserve 4 rooms, he said " I have two rooms double queen, but the other two you have to get suites, no more double queens", so I did. Couple hours later I checked their site and found out that there were double queen rooms available; I knew Aaron was trying to get rid of the suites. So reserved online and then I called and spoke to a lady at reservation, so I asked if there was rooms at that date, and she said “sure we have four, would you like to reserve?” I couldn’t believe. She said there was more even after I reserved two rooms double queen beds online, so following day I canceled two suites. Now, when we checked in, it was Aaron who helped me. Gave me the rooms that I reserved online in the middle of Bay and Marina, right in front on other hotels garbage area, I have pictures, when I went back, they said internet reservations guarantees for second floor, not a view. I was shocked to hear that. My confirmation said “BAY VIEW”, so their site. Even though they changed the rooms next day, I'm sure he did it purposely, cause I confronted him that “while you said double beds are sold out, I found out there was at least 4 more”. Be careful especially if you’re talking to Aaron. Other big problem, I reserved for dinner 16 people for following evening, unfortunately 3 or 4 people ate at a time, like they serve food for 3, then wait 10 min. then food for 4, then another 10 min. It is very simple. If you can't serve for 16, don't accept the reservation. Imagine those who ate at first, were done eating and still there were 3 people without food, still waiting. And when we asked for manager the lady at the bar got very nasty, we just wanted to leave the nasty environment. I WILL NOT GO THERE ANYMORE, THEY ARE NOT TRUSTWORTHY.

Reviews.Title: “More sympathetic choices in the area”
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my nanny and son so my wife and I could relax at a near by hotel (Kona Kai resort) and still be near our 13 month old. It would have been our first trip together since the birth of our son but unfortunately he came down with a sudden stomach virus that caused us to be unable to make the trip. I called the bay club to cancel my reservations over 24 hours in advance but unfortunately they could not do anything for us and i was charged for a nights rate. Our reservation at nearby Kona Kai was happily cancelled with a very caring and sympathetic woman wishing my son a speedy recovery. Long story short, we made the trip the following weekend and the entire family stayed at Kona Kai, great place and GREAT customer service! Bay club, not so much. I understand policy but come on, exceptions can be made sometimes right?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: RPonech
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Bay Club, location is fantastic right across the street from the bay. This was our first trip to Shelter Island and we really loved the location. Our room was very large, nothing fancy but very clean and with a small deck which overlooked the bay. The breakfast buffet which was included in the room cost was more than plentiful with a nice assortment. Found the staff to be very friendly and helpful with any questions we had. Though we did take the bus once down to Old Town without any problems we feel a car is definately needed .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: WamsCJ
Reviews.Content: I purchased a groupon to stay at the Bay Club. This was a staycation for my husband and I . Our room was beautiful, large and spacious. We requested a bay side room so we could see the skyline, the balacony was very tiny, barely enough room for the two plastic chairs. The Marina side rooms had large blaconies, maybe I will stay on that the next time I stay. The service was good, they have a shuttle available so you don't have to take a taxi, very friendly driver. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Geri B
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in San Diego and Shelter Island. We never have been in San Diego, I am so glad that we stayed on Shelter Island. It was so peaceful, and yet close to everything. The service at the Bay Club was wonderful. The food exceptional, the rooms were beautiful and the view fabulous. We will return to San Diego and we will stay at the Bay club. Everyone was so friendly and service A+.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LoisCarmenDenomiator
Reviews.Content: Shelter Island is the best place to stay in SD and The Bay Club is a top choice. It is very down to earth friendly but with great views and good amenities. The staff is a friendly as you can get. You are only 10 minutes from the airport or downtown but mentally a mile away. Watch the boats in the marina from your room or the pool. Walk across the street and you are on the beach and can watch local fishermen coming in with their catch along with seals playing. This place is great!.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Marianne D
Reviews.Content: My daughter, 1 year old grandson and I stayed at the Bay Club for 4 nights the 2nd week of September. We stayed on the 1st floor marina side of the hotel with 2 queen beds and it was just perfect. The room was very clean and spacious with plenty of room for my grandson’s travel bed. The view from the balcony was beautiful. Each morning we feasted on the full complimentary breakfast before heading out to explore SD so we did not need to waste time looking for a place to eat each morning. The breakfast had the same basics every morning with a few items swapped out so as not to get boring each day. I loved the breakfast and my daughter who is nursing my grandson with food allergies received a specially prepared breakfast with no dairy including no butter in the preparation! Each morning the restaurant manager would greet us and asks if she would like a special breakfast prepared for her which was quickly delivered. How’s that for service! We visited SeaWorld, SD Zoo and the Safari Park and the hotel pool and hot tub were greatly appreciated after a fun filled tiring day. The day of the power failure we arrive at the hotel late at night and we were greeting in the parking lot by the hotel attendant holding a flashlight. He helped us get to our room and gave us a glow stick to help us see our way around. There are so many sights that we did not have time to take in so we are hoping to return to SD next year and we will definitely stay at The Bay Club Hotel and Marina when we do

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Wienerfish
Reviews.Content: You'll read those words on their internet website and I found them to be totally true. We have stayed here on 3 separate occasions and have always found them to be one of the best places to stay in San Diego. Great location, reasonable prices, excellent restaurant, and top-notch service. Shuttle service means you may not need a rental car if you are just planning on staying at the hotel for a short visit. We have always had a great marina view from our room, which by the way is very spacious and equipped with all the amenities you might need. Do yourself a favor and stay here the next time you are visiting San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Views, Live Music”
Reviews.Author: mjelster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for five days - perfect location, near everything, five minutes from airport, views of bay, marina, Point Loma. Live big name concerts outside next door - saw Tears for Fears for free while sitting in the hotel's hot tub drinking a beer. Nice rooms with fridge. Definitely get a Marina view on the second floor. Bay view looks across parking lot and road. To avoid bar and pool noise at night, stay in west wing. Only place to stay in SD - Nice large breakfast, too, included. Ate every morning outside by the pool. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Lkrow
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Bay Club Hotel in San Diego for a week. The hotel has a nice restaurant area, an outdoor pool and hot tub, large HD television in the room, free wi-fi and complimentary buffet breakfast. Also there is a refrigerator in the room, but no microwave. The location is on Shelter Island and one side of the hotel faces the Marina and the other side faces a public boat launch and beach on San Diego Bay. It only has two floors and the rooms on the second floor have the best view. On the downside, our reservation was for a Bay View room with 2 double beds. We did not get our room request despite the fact that we made our reservation 3 months in advance. The room we got had one queen bed and was on the second floor with a Marina view. The view was nice, but we would have preferred to at least have the 2 double beds that we wanted. Also, on arriving, our room was really hot and the air conditioner was not working properly. We asked to be moved to another room and were told that the hotel was full. They said they would send someone up to look at it, and when we came back to the room later, someone had been there, but it still was not working. After several days, the outdoor temp had risen to 85 and the room was very uncomfortable, so I called again complaining about the air conditioner. They wanted to send someone up again and I said that it was not fixed the last time and insisted that they move us to another room. At this point they did let us move to a Bay View room. It still had the queen bed, but at least the air conditioner worked. Also we felt that the beds and pillows were not very comfortable compared to other hotels we have stayed in. On the plus side, they do have a buffet breakfast every day which consisted of eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, oatmeal, english muffins, fruit, toast and some cold cereals. The entire week was basically the same menu, except one day they added pancakes and one day waffles. I would suggest that they should include some low fat yogurt and more fruit choices. The breakfast is supposed to be self-serve, but they have waitresses that keep wanting to refill your coffee and juice and then they put a ticket on your table expecting a tip which was rather annoying. Also, they do charge $5 a day for parking, which I think should be free when you are paying a good price for a hotel room. But we figured that the complimentary breakfast everyday somewhat offset the parking charge. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay there, despite the air conditioner problem. The hotel has a nice location, the food was decent, and it is not far from the airport or the downtown area. I would rate this as a 2 to 2 1/2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: UKUser
Reviews.Content: Will never stay anywhere else in San Diego again. Helpfuo and friendly service. Great downtown location. Many restaurants within walking distance. Lovely rooms with either bay or marina view. Good breakfast. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jomomma8
Reviews.Content: Planning a birthday party for 36 people when you live 500 miles away isn't easy, but Tammy & Amalia made it simple! We stayed 4 nights here and had the party on the 2nd night. The service was exceptional!!! Laura was so friendly and willing to help! Sandy, Amanda, Jody, John...everyone was awesome! The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable! View of the marina was so relaxing! We would stay at this location again for sure! A short taxi ride to downtown was easy and about $20 (we didn't want to have to worry about parking). Loved the included hot breakfast! All of us enjoyed our stay at The Bay Club and I would highly recommend it! Thanks Bay Club! We all loved our visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Hotel with a Great View”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel which is built on a man made peninsula caled Shelter Island. We had a bay view room which gave us a fab view of the San Diego skyline. We can'f fault the service at all. On our first day we arrived early and were told that we could check in early, but if we waited for our assigned room, it would be one with a better view. We parked the car and went sightseeing and when the room was ready the receptionist called to confirm. That night we ate in the hotel. The food was lovely and the portion size was good. The following morning we witnessed one of the aircraft carriers leaving the bay, which made my husband's stay! We felt the hotel was in a great spot, local to Seaworld and the Old Town but that if you wanted to taxi it into Seaport Village or the Gaslamp Quarter it was a $24 taxi ride each way. On our second night the reception staff offered to drive us to a local restaurant and collect us after our meal-what a great service! Breakfast was basic but plentiful with a lovely smiley waiter who couldn't do enough for you. Also found the laundry room really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass this place by...a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: indyrae
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this hotel on 8/28/11. First, let me say that I am very picky when it comes to hotels! The Bay Club Hotel and Marina is a great choice hands down! The Bay Club was my choice after a few weeks spent researching hotels in San Diego. This was my third trip to the area and I wanted to try something new. When I first saw the photo's I thought that perhaps the hotel may be a little dated and some of the reviews made me think that might be the case. However, the overwhelming comments about how clean it was and how great the staff was (not to mention the ranking number) helped me make my decision. I couldn't have made a better choice. The staff is just great. The parking is only $5.00 per day; the rooms are clean, VERY quiet and the location is great. It is minutes from the airport, downtown and a short drive to La Jolla. They staff is great about giving you directions and recommendations for the area. I was amazed that a large bottle of water from the gift store was only $1.50. In any other hotel it would have cost much more. The breakfast in the morning was nice and again, the staff wonderful. I did tip the servers and they deserve it. I was surprised to see some comments about not leaving a tip; come on people, after all, for the great rate AND free breakfast why would anyone opt NOT to? If anyone would dare be able to afford a vacation and not leave at least a few dollars then shame on you! Read the book Nickeled and Dimed in America and then think twice about such decisions. I digress; take it from someone who takes her time making hotel selections and someone who searches for the best value and clean, nicely appointed rooms; this is a great choice. The decor is island decor but the bedspreads are some of the cleanest I have seen; better than some of the "upscale" hotels I have stayed in. If you are staying in the area, don't be afraid to give it a try; you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Get Away From The Heat”
Reviews.Author: 77Margaret
Reviews.Content: Front desk was friendly Had fish and chips the first night it was disgusting and was not wreath the money???? Never went back to eat dinner in the restaurant for the rest of our stay... Breakfast was a good deal it was in the price of our room:) I think at breakfast time they need a little more HELP..... Landry room...... Be "prepared" to wait up to at leased 3 hours to wash and dry your cloths as the manager of the marina likes to wash and dry her towels while working her 8 hour's I don't understand why she had to use the washer and dryer while there was guests waiting I thought that was very inconsiderate not cool :(

Reviews.Title: “A favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: beachbumLongIsland
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at Bay Club Hotel and Marina for 3 nights. It was a great pick for us. It's on Shelter Island, which is about 5 minutes from downtown San Diego, but not the city. We had a 2nd floor marina view room. I booked it online a couple of weeks prior to our stay and we got a great rate of $169.00 a night. The setting was lovely - our balcony offered a peaceful view of the marina. Breakfast is included. There are about 4 warm breakfast offerings each day along with fresh fruit, coffee, juice cereal and toast. They give you a receipt at breakfast to sign and fill in a tip amount if you choose to do so. We didn't sign it 2 out of the 3 mornings we were there. The room was really large and the bed super comfortable. We had an issue with our shower that was completely resolved within 20+ minutes time from when we telephoned the front desk. I recommend parking in the below ground parking because the spaces up top are too narrow. Parking was an additional $5.00 per day. The hotel is located 5 minutes from the airport but you don't hear the noise. There is a fitness center that seemed to be a secret and there was a computer and printer in the lobby where you can print your airplane boarding passes. A real nice restaurant at the end of Shelter Island is Bali Hai. The view of San Diego fantastic and it's a beautiful setting with great food. Also, we went to see the Mets play the Padres at Petco Stadium. You can get really premium seats for really cheap (according to New York standards) or pay as little as $10 to sit and watch the game. It's a great stadium. All of this is 5-10 minutes from this wonderful hotel. We certainly will return on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: nilla
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Shelter Island. We really enjoyed our stay at the Bay Club and Marina. The relaxation of the area is wonderful!! This hotel is located about 15 mins from the airport in a safe and beautiful area. The Bay Club is a small hotel only 2 floors, but it is HUGE on service. We can not say enough how AWESOME the staff is. Jody, you rock!!! the front desk, the breakfast wait staff all AMAZING!! housekeeping always aiming to please. The Bay Club management is very blessed to have this Amazing dedicated staff. We thank all of you for a very enjoyable stay .We hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location and great food....we would absolutely go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Heather C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated out of the downtown but central to highway access (without the noise and yucky views of actually staying right off a highway). We were able to get downtown in minutes and it was a quick drive to places like Sunset Cliffs, Mission Beach, La Jolla and Torrey Pines. The breakfast in the mornings is wonderful. A small tip to the (very nice) servers is well worth the meal to get you going for the day. The hotel is older, but is well maintained. We enjoyed the pool and hot-tub. The views of the marina are gorgeous!! We had a great sleep and would recommend it to anyone looking to stay in a CLEAN but not extravagant hotel. It is certainly a huge step up from the small ones located around hotel circle. We will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Let vacation begin!”
Reviews.Author: 1Melissa
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried with the pictures I saw on the website that this hotel was going to look dated and seem a bit hokey with the thick bamboo-looking furniture - WRONG! In person, I thought everything looked just fine. I walked into our room and was struck by the large quarters and beautiful view of the bay (even from our 1st floor room!) I felt like I finally was on vacation. The pool was big enough for our kids and actually felt heated! Breakfast was okay. Many selections, but I was expecting a bit better from the raves. ( I was expecting a lot more from many things in San Diego due to Trip Advisor raves, and found myself a LITTLE disappointed on quite a few things.) I was a bit irritated that the breakfast personnel bring you your drinks, but then leave a paper and pen for you to leave a tip. Sorry, but I didn't tip. If a breakfast is listed as COMPLIMENTARY, then don't pull this move and expect extra $! But, back to business . . . There is a small beach with bonfire rings right across the street from the hotel. I saw several large Navy ships pass by. COOL!!! We also walked three hotels down and the kids played at the bayside playground. The only negatives were: the water coming from the sink was a bit yucky when brushing our teeth and the A/C did not run continuously during the night and would wake us up when starting up (at least the first night of our 3 night stay.) There was a concert at Humphries our last night, but the music was turned down and could hear it a little from the pool area, but not disturbing at all! I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Louise M
Reviews.Content: This was a splurge for us on a SoCal trip, and we loved it. The location was amazing, the room was very large, well decorated, and all the comforts one would hope for. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixBrit
Reviews.Content: Great value and location! Hotel has it all; huge clean rooms, beautiful views, great food. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: maryduncan
Reviews.Content: hotel was fantastic. only 12 minutes from airport and downtown. Room was huge. Staff was excellant. view was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: tkttoride
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bay Club Hotel and Marina on July 27, 2011 to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The front desk service was friendly and efficient. Very unexpectedly, we were upgraded to a junior suite on the second floor. The room had two balconies and overlooked the marina. The accommodations were spotless and very inviting, with a comfortable king bed and a sitting area with a comfy couch, two chairs, and a coffee table. The room itself was very quiet, but guests should be aware that Humphreys next door features outdoor concerts on summer evenings and the music and applause are very audible from the Bay Club. The hot buffet breakfast in the morning included potatoes, sausage, bacon, and scrambled eggs plus toast, fresh fruit, and cereal. The food was only lukewarm, but tasty nonetheless. My husband and I did not appreciate that the tv in the breakfast room was turned to FOX "News." That we could have done without. However, all in all, our stay was very enjoyable and we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Value, Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SunSeeker62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently got away for a couple of days to San Diego and stayed at the Bay Club Hotel. It was our first trip to San Diego and I did a lot of research on hotels in the area and wanted a reasonably priced hotel that was close to downtown but not in downtown and on the water. The Bay Club Hotel was a terrific choice for us. The staff were very nice and helpful. The food at the restaurant was good and the free breakfast was above average which we found to be a big plus. The pool and huge hot tub provided much needed relief at night to rejuvenate our feet from the walking we did during the day. The rooms were very large and gave us plenty of space to move around and the balcony looking over the marina was amazing especially in the morning. Great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel as well. Very easy drive to downtown. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ofield
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a super location. It is a little bit out of town so you will need transport but it is worth it to avoid plane noise as the main airport is in the middle of the City. Room was well furnished and modern. Housekeeping good. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice/variety. We had an evening meal at the hotel and it was of a reasonable standard. Good fitness area and pool. If we had one gripe it would be very minor and it is to do with the location of the pool. It is difficult to get to other than through the bar so for those that would be a little conscious of walking through such an area/swimming in an area overlooked by the bar/restaurant it may be an issue. Overall though we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: rhionsnana
Reviews.Content: Everything, as usual, was exceptional. The staff is beyond compare, with Brandi, John, Patrick , Tim & Amanda giving the great service that the hjotel is famous for. We will be returning "HOME" to TBC many times again. You guys are the greatest!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler58820
Reviews.Content: I took my son to the Bay Club for his 13th birthday. The reviews I read didn't even begin to describe this place! The staff is so friendly and wonderful! This was our first attempt at restaurant food since his recent food allergy diagnosis. Both Brandi and Laurie remembered everything he could eat, read ingredients and came up with the most delicious meal choices. They were so friendly and helpful we didn't eat anywhere else during our entire trip. Tim sent us a special fruit and cheese basket and made sure we were in a lovely room overlooking the water so we could watch the Stingrays swim below us a night! Super cool! Jody acted more like a friend than a hotel employee. All the staff treated us like family. The room was so large, with high ceilings and a fabulous marina view! The location is fantastic - the island's only beach area is right across the street and we saw many people enjoying the fire pits every night. You can see and hear the bands at the Humphrey's Amphitheater next door from the hot tub and pool. This place is incredible and we are already saving for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to see fireworks”
Reviews.Author: goseeusa
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club Hotel and Marina is located on Shelter Island on the Big bay in San Diego. They set up 4 barges in the bay with synchronized fire works from each barge. One barge was right in front of our hotel and we saw the most fantastic show ever! The hotel was updated since the last time we were there 4 years ago with new A/C units and carpeting. There were also changes made to the free breakfast buffet. This is a wonderful, smallish hotel with great views of the bay and the San Diego skyline. The staff really tries to please. We wanted to extend our stay 1 more day even though it was a holiday week and they were able to accommodate us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JaneLasVegas
Reviews.Content: The hotel, while older, was better than I expected. Had a AAA rating for 2011 which I didn't know before I checked in. I found the front desk staff to be very accommodating. I needed to print/sign documents, their business center printer was out of ink and they made everything happen for me. The breakfast buffet, bar, front desk and maid staff was very friendly. The room was nicely and recently renovated, although they need more outlets for the number of electronics people have these days. Nice location with views of the harbor and bay. Love the balcony. I would recommend this to anyone going to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel, with comfortable rooms and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: skchord
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for our trip...we had my husband and I, our 16 month old, and 2 teenage boys. We had a 2 queen room and it was perfect...not too small at all. The beds were surprisingly comfortable (and being 32 weeks pregnant during our vacation that says a lot), and the pillows and bedding were soft and cozy. We had a marina view room and it was nice to wake up looking out over the boats in the marina. The hotel itself is pretty. A big reason for us to book this was the $5 parking and free full breakfast, hard to find in San Diego (trust us...we looked!!!). It is also centrally located just 6 miles from Sea World, and 12 from the zoo and close to the coast for beaches. The staff were friendly and helpful at every turn and made our daughter special pancakes on a morning when they didn't have any available...made her day which made ours. Highly recommend this hotel...free wi-fi and happy hour from 4-7 with drink specials and free appetizers. (And the salsa is REALLY, REALLY good!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “San Diego get-away...even for San Diegans”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJMC
Reviews.Content: We spent our anniversary at the Bay Club and loved the view of the San Diego Harbor from our room. Great to get up and take a walk along the water. A full buffet breakfast, included in our stay, welcomed us back after our walk.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at the Bay Club Hotel & Marina”
Reviews.Author: FashionLover87
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Bay Club Hotel & Marina. I really enjoyed my first stay at this hotel, so when looking for a place to stay for my daughter's 6th birthday, I knew I wanted to stay here again. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was warm and welcoming. I needed assistance with my luggage and a very friendly gentleman took my bags to my room and also offered very helpful suggestions for delicious restaurants in the area. Our room had a limited view of the marina, however, it was nothing major (a fence slightly blocked our view). The room was simple and spacious enough for an adult and small child. The only downfall to the room was that I could hear my upstairs neighbors every step very early in the morning and very late at night. Other than that, it was a very quiet and pleasant room. We only ate the complimentary breaking once during our 3 day stay and I was somewhat disappointed. During the week, breakfast ends at 10AM and we arrived around 9AM and all of the food containers were on the verge of being empty. The food was warm and it was delicious (I had an egg dish, sausage, bacon, and toast), I just wish there were waffles like there was during my first stay at the hotel. I guess I came on the wrong morning! Overall, this was another relaxing stay at the Bay Club Hotel and Marina and I would definitely come to this hotel again sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: offtoneverland
Reviews.Content: We had nothing but excellent service from the staff (front desk, restaurant staff, cleaning staff) from the very first minute of stepping in to the hotel. Only used the complimentary shuttle service once and driver was very pleasant and did not mind answering all our questions about the area. Desk staff was always more than willing to answer our many questions. Restaurant staff was the best staff we have ever come acrossed. Complimentary breakfast buffet was the norm but always hot and plentiful. Every day we enjoyed the beautiful view of the harbor while eating breakfast. We ate lunch and dinner there twice and would not hesitate to return. Room was clean and maid service was always there if we needed anything. We were all very pleased with our pick of this hotel for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Treatment! Amazing, Awesome, Wonderful EVERYTHING!! It's like staying with well loved family”
Reviews.Author: Kiralin
Reviews.Content: First, let me preface this with I have stayed here at various times over the last 6 years! I go for my "Karen get-away time"! EVERY VISIT has been AMAZING! It is like staying with a well loved family who cares for your every need and wish! My last visit was in mid May, 2011 for my husband's and my 35th wedding anniversary. We were greeted by Tim, Mike and staff upon our arrival and immediately given personalized VIP service. The room we requested was not available when we made the original reservation. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised when we were given the key to our favorite, requested room! In addition we were treated to other special ammenities due to our special celebration. (Thank you so very, very much). This made our landmark anniversary so memorable and special. We were defintiely treated like VIP's! Did I mention that this has been the case every time I have stayed here? We ate in the cafe for dinner and the food is 5 stars! The service is 5 stars and the view is 5 stars!!! They include a delicicous full breakfast in the morning (and be sure to ask Raul about Steven, the Seagull!!! ;) Everyone from the maide service, front desk, cafe staff, and excellent bar tenders to top management are there to make the visit all that you could anticipate. The rooms are comfortable, beds and pillows are perect, the entire facility is very clean with nice ammentiites. The pool area is beautiful with a nice view and in addition you can walk across the road to the beach to swim and and watch everything form small boats to cruise ships float by, or walk along the beuatiful board walk and have a bonfire party at night! It is only about 5 miles from Old Town and Seaport Village! The value, very good!! I highly recommend a get away and stay at the Bay Club and Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Californian Delight”
Reviews.Author: ThreeLegsIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in perfect location. Marina view room preferable to harbour view. Spacious well furnished room with balcony and large HD television. Staff friendly and very helpful. Fully cooked breakfast - buffet style. Lovely swimming pool and jacuzzi. This is not a city location, it's a quiet marina about two miles from the centre. Petty car parking charge of $5 per night! Free internet

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service at a 3 Star Price!”
Reviews.Author: LaurellT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our second stay with the Bay Club Hotel and Marina on Shelter Island in San Diego, and had another wonderful experience! We can't say enough about how friendly and efficient the staff at this hotel are. Their great service started when our plane arrived late into San Diego, shortly after 11PM, meaning we’d missed the last shuttle the hotel offers. We phoned the hotel from the airport and the shuttle driver "Aaron" was kind enough to put an extra 1/2 hour on the clock to come pick us up. How nice is that? We were given a beautiful Marina view room with a very comfortable king-sized bed. Each room facing the marina has its own balcony so you can sit outside and enjoy the serene view of the boats before you. We've never stayed on the Bay side of the hotel, but it looks to offer another great view of the Bay and all the activities therein. You really can't go wrong staying on either side of the hotel, we just felt the marina side might be a little quieter. The room was very clean, had a Big Screen TV, plenty of channels on the Cable (which we appreciated for the Stanley Cup Playoffs - we're Canadian, eh?), and a small fridge. If there was one fault we could find, and it's minor, it would be that the bathroom could use a little updating, other than that we had absolutely no complaints about our room. The staff are beyond courteous. Each morning they have a delicious and substantial breakfast buffet and our waiter "Raul" was top-notch in his friendly and efficient service. You might be lucky enough to see "Steven Seagull" peering through the window as you're dining on breakfast. This bird and his wife "Rita" have become friends with Raul and are often seen waiting by the window hoping for an extra food-treat to come their way. One guest went so far as to write a heart-warming short story on the bird’s relationship with Raul. You'll find the story located in the gift shop at the hotel,” Steven’s Story", it's a delightful read! You couldn't have a better location than to stay on Shelter Island. The walkway by the ocean is gorgeous, and the hotel is central to every place you'd want to go in San Diego. We rented a vehicle, and there again we recieved great service when our hotel shuttle driver "Patrick" was kind enough to drive us to the car rental location. Before leaving the hotel and taking a flight back home the Front Desk Manager "Tim" suggested they could print our Boarding Passes for us to make the departure that much quicker. Just another "perk" to staying at this great hotel! We will definitely return to this hotel, and would highly recommend it to all! My only trepidation in writing this is that the hotel will become too popular and there won't be a room for us next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for seeing San Diego”
Reviews.Author: dflom
Reviews.Content: Not having been to San Diego before, I looked for the most affordable hotel in a good location. It was just by luck (and other reviews) that I found The Bay Club. The hotel is on Shelter Island, a convenient location to see the sights from. It is an older hotel, but very well maintained. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. You have the option of either a bay view, or marina view. We opted for the bay view, and enjoyed watching the ships move about. Realize that you'll be looking over a parking lot, so a second floor room is best. By the way, it's a great walking area since the entire length of the shore line is a park. The staff at the hotel was excellent, all very helpful and attentive. And the breakfast is not the standard continental one that most hotels offer. It consistently offered scrambled eggs, fried potatos, fresh fruit, and often pancakes. Plus, you look out at the beautiful boats in the marina as you eat. A lovely place!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: phxgal00
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights during our wedding weekend. The place is WONDERFUL. The room was beautiful, the breakfast delicious and tasty, and last but not least the staff was amazing! We had about 20 rooms booked for guests for our wedding. The staff made sure we were taken care of. The were accomodating of early check-ins. At the last minute, they were able to get us a shuttle to the wedding site. The bellman spent lots of time talking to my fiance's folks who are older and do not travel much. The front desk staff knew who we were but were not intrusive. The day after the wedding, they called to confirm it was okay to clean our room. We can't say enough about how much we enjoyed the stay. For the view and the location and the breakfast, the rate is an absolute bargain! Can't wait to go back on our anniversary. Thank you!!! You exceeded every expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisey making it hard to get any rest”
Reviews.Author: deberah25
Reviews.Content: We went and bought a fan to attept to cover all the lobby noise and peoples TV in next room. For the price of the room, expected better noise control then Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettHoney
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Bay Club. It was quiet, pleasant, clean and well maintained. I don't like paying for parking, which was only $5 per day, but the fabulous hot buffet breakfast included w/ the room, made up for it. I did have an internet connection problem, but wasn't sure if it was me, or the hotel connection. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great location great place”
Reviews.Author: freonmanPhoenixAz
Reviews.Content: this place in located right on the bay, great room, underground parking garage(only $5 a day) free breakfast buffet. allaround great service, very friendly and helpful staff. i will stay here again and again. thx guys for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-away”
Reviews.Author: suzibrad
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel through groupon, and our stay exceeded our expectations! We had a lovely room with a view of the harbor, and there was a walkway all along the San Diego Bay . Pool area was small, but tables were set up outside for our breakfast (included) and happy hour. A great hotel for the value we will be returning to, even without the Groupon!

Reviews.Title: “better than hoped for”
Reviews.Author: bmcuscgr94
Reviews.Content: Hotle was recommended by a friend who used to work there many years ago. Was concerned things might have changed. Room was nice, view of habor entrance and navy base I enjoyed. Dining was excellent: food was outstanding and view of marina couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: VFT
Reviews.Content: I had my reservations about staying 3 nights at the Bay Club, but was pleasantly surprised. The location at Shelter Island provides a 'resort like' feel and is a great spot for those who like to walk/run in the mornings and be a bit removed from the city. The complimentary morning breakfasts certainly help prepare you for local attractions, with bacon, eggs, sausages, toast, cereals and oats. The changing hot breakfast item progressively improved throughout our stay, from a miscellaneous omlette hash to french toast before pancakes on our last day! It is a great base and close location for those going to San Diego Zoo and Sea World. We even caught a snippet of the James Blunt concert that was on at the nearby Harvey's hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FullOfWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Bay Club Hotel & Marina has a lot to offer for the price. The rooms are standard, but quite spacious and very clean. Each room has a balcony and refrigerator, perfect for enjoying a drink or two while watching the sunset. Or, if you rather a sunset view on the ocean, Sunset Cliffs is a mere 7 minute drive away (and totally worth it!). This location is worth the stay in contrast to the other local "fancy" hotels for two things: an excellent (and free) daily breakfast buffet and free wireless internet. The staff was also very accomodating. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: crellis2000
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in San Diego on a sight seeing trip and 4 of the nights were at this Hotel. The service was excellent. The rooms and hotel very clean.I did have to ask a waitress to wipe down the arm of a chair on the patio, but that was really a small annoyance. The included buffet breakfast was good and the free transport to and from the airport was excellent. For $5.00 they gave us a lift to the downtown area. We were very happy with the furnishings in the room. We found the room/meal package to be somewhat expensive so we chose to eat out. We had a room on the west side (facing the marina) and also a room on the east side (facing the street and Downtown) both are O.K.We will go there next time

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel for a very reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Omnefos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bay Club Hotel and Marina in San Diego for three days and could not have been more pleased with the service, the food, the hotel quality, and the price. The reason for my stay was I was attending a training conference at a near by hotel which had a terrible rating according to the reviews on Trip Advisor. After searching for alternate hotels in the area, I found the reviews rated the Bay Club Hotel very high. After all was said and done, I even got a marina view room for about $10.00 less than the conference hotel. The only real down side to the hotel was the fact that they charge you $5.00 per night for parking, but the parking was adequate and easily accessed. The buffet breakfast, which was inlcuded with the room price, was excellent (except for the first day when the potatoes tasted like they had been sitting on the warmer for about three hours). The service staff was very efficient and my room was always cleaned by the time I returned to the hotel at noon. The front desk staff were always cheerful, friendly, and very willing to assist with any needs, i.e., off site eating establishments. Since the hotel is located at the marina, it is just a couple of miles from the airport and Old Town, I will definately use the Bay Club Hotel for my base any time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite by far”
Reviews.Author: donnawray
Reviews.Content: This is a place that throws out the welcome mat for us every time we stay. They are friendly and go over and beyond what most hotels do for their guests. They serve a delicious breakfast daily and have hors d'oeuvres in the afternoon. The staff knows our name and makes sure we have everything we need to make our stay comfortable. You can hear the evening concerts next door at Humphrey's from the pool on summer evenings. I wanted everyone I know to see why I have been raving about this place for the past 6 years, so I let The Bay Club host my retirement party last June. Now my friends are going back to relax and experience this warm atmosphere again. We consider this our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel say we have had in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MOAAB
Reviews.Content: We travel to San Diego to visit with family on a regular basis. We have stayed at a few other hotels but were never quite satisfied with any of them. I ran across the Bay Club Hotel and Marina on the internet and decided to give it a try. I loved the location on Shelter Island being close to the airport and yet having great views of the bay. The room was clean, all of the staff were friendly and able to answer any questions we had, and the full breakfast was just cherry on top. When we return on our next visit we will be sure to book at the Bay Club Hotel and Marina for another wonderful and relaxing stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Less than desirable....”
Reviews.Author: ojaitravellers
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't look as advertized on their website, charging you for daily parking even though you park on the hotel grounds, location was horrible because you constantly heard jets and helicopters flying, even late at night, stayed in this hotel because mainly of free buffet breakfast but food was disgusting, couple days old potato which they served daily, not many choices and grouchy servers. Plus they make you sign a tab even though you're not charged they said its for accounting purposes. However, i think it just the way they get a tip for their grouchy servers. We were woken up one night by the guests next door to our room being loud at 2 in the morning. Tried room service one night, food was disgusting, almost throw up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Has the Basics Covered with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: Glee2544
Reviews.Content: Friendly smiles and helpful amenities in a clean, tropical style. Reception staff were all winsome with their practical advise and ability to do what they said they would do. Room was large with a desk, dresser, chair, two queen beds and large HD TV overlooking the marina. The bamboo decorations, although simple and outdated, had a tropical feel that was carried out throughout the hotel. Really appreciated the free hot buffet breakfast and free shuttle to the airport. The pool and fitness centre were on the small side, but were adequate and better than nothing. Their strength is in their genuine care for their customers; I'd stay again if needing accommodation in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great views, and great complimentary breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: Audizzle
Reviews.Content: The desk service was great. The location was easy to find with our GPS and the view of the bay and of the marina was really impressive. The rooms were clean and spacious enough for our family of 4. One thing that worried me was the loud noise everytime a plane took off. I guess the hotel is close to an airport? But I wore some earplugs and didn't hear any planes during the night. We all enjoyed the warm complimentary breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and I would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking, nice pool, food was poor, good for a basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sillygoose01
Reviews.Content: good basic hotel. nice to be right on the water. Sometimes you can hear the sea lions, but not bothersome. food was terrible, but lots of other options near by. pool was good. free parking a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome placeto stay , within miles of places to see and things to do.”
Reviews.Author: Dad2mad
Reviews.Content: Service was excellant, room was beautiful , and had a great view. Location was near the ocean, and not far from many beaches. Don't have any complaints. Complimentary breakfast was better then most places we've stayed. Very quiet place , with a balcony that overlooked the Marina, and the pool. Would stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: AHWS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights back in Nov '10. Read about it in this website. We were able to get a room the day of our stay, they were able to accomodate our late check in time (after 10pm). Nice room. Nothing fancy. Clean. The decor could use a little updating but I'm not there to stare at the room. The bed was comfortable. We had a nice little balcony facing the marina. We stayed on the bottom floor. The one problem I had with the place, which I didn't mention to the staff, was I think the ceilings are thin. There must have been a family which had small children in the room above us that kept running back and forth. It was loud. I think even when they were just walking normally (or they just naturally stomp around) we could hear each step. Word to the wise, tread lightly if staying on the top floor, or stay on the top if you don't want to hear people walking above you. The continental breakfast sufficed. It wasn't excellent but it wasn't terrible. The staff treat you well there. They help serve you, set the tables for you, get your drinks. I was a little surprised when they handed me a receipt to sign, so we included a tip. i've not had that done at any other continental breakfasts in other hotels, but they do serve you more than at another place. Decently located. Easy to find. Nice area across the way to just walk along the water. The fee was good. I was able to get a lower price calling the hotel directly than the fees I saw on travel websites. I would stay there again, if I was in that area again, but I probably wouldn't just because I'd like to try something different. But it was a good, decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: THM07
Reviews.Content: How have I not written a review on this hotel?? We stayed in this hotel last year and I thought it was great! It was clean, and the staff is AMAZING. The decor may be a bit dated, but this is a 3 star hotel, not a 5 and the cost of the room is well worth it. We stayed in a corner room and it was quite, and had a very nice view from the window of our room. The breakfast is buffet style, wide variety of foods besides the usual orange juice and pastry. I thought it was decent for the cost (free) and the fiance' and I really enjoyed eating outside with a nice view of the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Cacofonix123
Reviews.Content: I have created a tripadvisor ID just so I could have my say about this great hotel. I read some reviews about the dated decor but if you're willing to look past that the value for money is awesome. The service is first class from the front desk to the restaurant and cleaning staff. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location to most of the touristy stuff is great - no more than 15 minutes to most places (I did vacation a little before spring break so that may be a factor). The real value is the breakfast - a free hot breakfast with a view of the marina. Great hotel that I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Canada5121
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this fine hotel for one week February 2011. Started with a very friendly check in person at the desk. The room was totally amazing, so clean with a lovely bed. The view of the marina from our balcony was a treasure each night. The breakfast every morning was excellent and the service was oustanding especially our waiter Raul. Also had a dinner at the hotel one night which was also wonderful. The food was excellent and the service was oustanding. I will stay at this lovely hotel when I return to San Diego in the future. Thank you for a wonderful experience at your 5 star hotel. Most of the all the price was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denmartravelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 small children for 3 nights and love the hotel. We had a wonderful view of the marina and our hotel room was very large. I was very pleased with the continental breakfast, it was more than your usual muffins and bagels. It was nice to have a hot breakfast every morning. The pool was lovely and quiet, however we were unable to get the high speed internet on our iphone. My last comment is about Steven the Seagull, thank you for sharing his story with us...we look forward to seeing him again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & great location for families”
Reviews.Author: lilbirds
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay here with our toddler - the laid back and unpretentious atmosphere was good for us. Staff were very helpful. Room had excellent view of the bay (worth getting 2nd floor), was quiet. Location could not be better for a family - safe, quiet, clean, spectacular views, small beach across the street, lots of green grass to run on, enjoyed walking on the waterfront park with the playground. It's a 12 minute walk to the bus stop, & restaurants within 10-15 min walking distance. We didn't have a car so it was good to be able to walk to the bus--with some pre-planning (see MTS website) we could get to most tourist sites within an hour, like Mission Beach, Sea world & Balboa Park. The front desk will give you a handy bus guide if you ask for it. Breakfast was plentiful & the staff were always very nice to give us a box to pack some snacks for the kids. While there is a tip form, it is not expected. We also appreciated the no-alcohol policy at the pool & hot tub since we have small kids. Small details would have made it a 5* for us. Minor updating (i.e. the carpet in the public areas, update the dim lighting in the hallways) would make a big difference. It didn't bother us, as the rooms themselves were very clean & nice, but don't expect a brand-new glitzy lobby. The restaurant has good food but nothing fancy. Make sure you know where the shuttle stop is downtown to get a ride back, if you decide to use the hotel's shuttle service (it's $5 to go downtown but free to airport) - its by Old Town Trolley station near the Flagship/Hornblower cruises. Our shuttle drivers were all super friendly! It seems that the Shelter Island hotels are all quite similar---Humphrey's & the Best Western have better landscaping & decor (but no free breakfast), so depends what your priorities are!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel without the snootiness”
Reviews.Author: DIY_Vactioner
Reviews.Content: Terrific view - our son really enjoyed watching the military boats go by. Staff was polite and helpful. Room was clean and quiet. Breakfast was delicious. We stayed 3 nights and had a very positive, relaxing experience. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: scooterscruisers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night Jan 14/11 prior to our cruise. Overall impression was very good, although we booked this hotel because it had a complimentary airport and cruise shuttle. Unfortunately we were not aware that the airport shuttle only runs until 11pm so we missed it by 5 minutes and had to take a taxi for $12. We did however appreciate the shuttle to the cruise terminal the following morning, took maybe 10 minutes. We had a Bay view room on the second floor, it faced the parking lot but we didn't hear any traffic at all, the only thing we heard was trumpets playing Saturday morning at the nearby military base. We could also hear the TV in the next room, they did have it turned quite loud until the wee hours but we were so tired from travelling that we were able to sleep through it. I think if I stayed here again I would suggest a Marina view room. The room itself was clean and spacious, a little worn. We found the beds soft, the kind you end up both rolling into the middle by morning, but at least they were clean. Nice hot buffet breakfast with everything you could think of was included in the morning. A little tacky that the staff cleaning the tables and bringing your drink (which could have been on the buffet to begin with) handed you a pen & paper to fill out an additional tip, I've just never had that at a comp. self-serve buffet before. The decor was a little dated, kind of a Hawaiian theme, but still in pretty good shape. Overall an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “great snooze/cruise”
Reviews.Author: asfem
Reviews.Content: You have to ask for the cruise package because it is not advertised on their web site. Beautiful rooms and views, wonderful people from the front desk, to the bar, to the driver who takes you to the port--everyone treats you as if they own part of the hotel--love it!!.. Breakfast is included with the rooms--the variety was good but the food was cold---a shame because the quality was there---there's just something about cold eggs...yuk. I would stay here again and strongly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: no_info
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great location and a fair price. This is no 5 star hotel but with a a well stocked buffet breakfast and clean comfy rooms; do you need anything esle? And the location - just spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Awesome Food!!”
Reviews.Author: Mookerblu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the boyfriend. Great view of the marina, however our room was on the first floor facing the street. We ate at the restaurant one night and it was FANTASTIC!! A little expensive but amazing! I know this sounds silly but I really liked being able to do my laundry at this hotel. We stayed here halfway through our ten day trip and I got all my laundry done and walked around the marina while it was washing :) Parking is in a garage under the hotel, a little tight but no problem for our car.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindseyTaylor_10
Reviews.Content: I have to say, from the minute I phoned this hotel asking questions, to the moment I arrived through its front doors, my experience was incredible. The staff were all extremely friendly, and helpful. Any questions we had were always answered with a smile. The hot buffet breakfast, which was complementary with our stay, was great. I think I loved most the shuttle service that was offered. We were promptly picked up from the cruise ship terminal (which was complementary), and could also use the shuttle service to bring us to and from the cruise ship terminal (which was close to downtown, and much more) for a mere $5 per ride, that saved us a lot of money...taxi's would cost much more. The hotel is in a quiet area, overlooking either the bay, or their marina; either way, you have a great view from your huge hotel room. It was worth every penny to stay at this charming hotel. The one and only complaint I would say, is that you can hear noises from the hallway, and from other surrounding rooms, but wasn't really a big deal. I would stay there again in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: GeriJoe
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for Shelter Island hotels, I decided to try this hotel out. I can honestly say that this was the best advice we have ever taken. Our room (King Bay View) was Perfect! Large, quiet, clean and one of the most comfortable stays we have had. The ck - in was easy and quick. Breakfast in the morning - comp buffet was just the perfect way to start our trip home. We will definitely be recommending this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tfc10
Reviews.Content: Smallish, 2-storey hotel in a scenic location on Shelter Island with rooms overlooking the marina or San Diego Bay. Very easy to get to in a few minutes from the freeways or international airport and only a 10 min journey by car to downtown San Diego. Nice restaurant/bar leading out onto a pool deck with friendly staff. Several good value eating places within walking distance, but no shops nearby (unless you want to buy boat related stuff). Normally should be a very quiet location except for the occasional low flying US Navy jet shaking the building, but some noisy building work going on on the marina during daylight hours while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful friendly hotel with great service in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: wintervisitorYumaA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Club Hotel and Marina for four nights, using it as a base to explore San Diego and relax. Our room was beautiful - thanks, Tim - and the entire hotel was clean and comfortable. The hot breakfast (complimentary) was great, and much appreciated, and we also had a lunch and a dinner in the restaurant, which were very good. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We found the location very convenient to get to, as we were arriving in San Diego on I-8, and also very convenient for downtown, the beaches, and Balboa Park. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel with excellent view & great service”
Reviews.Author: mvpspc
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have stayed at this hotel on three seperate occasions and each time our experience has been wonderful. The hotel is situated on Shelter Island, close to the airport and Old Town, with a wonderful view of San Diego Bay and the Marina. However, the truly remarkable feature of this hotel is the 4 star service. The staff could not be more attentive to your needs. The food in the restuarant is very good. We would highly recommend this hotel to any visitors to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: libruce
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than i expected. Great room, great price, great free breakfasr, great service, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler4248
Reviews.Content: Everything said in previous reviews is true. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The free breakfast is varied and quite good. The restaurant also serves a limited lunch and dinner at reasonable prices. Most rooms have wide windows/patios facing either San Diego Bay with its busy activity or the marina with lots of pretty sail boats. However, they have a few rooms with small patios & windows with oblique views of the bay. If you really want a good view of the bay or marina from the window, please be sure to request it. The promenade in front of the hotel along the bay is a great way to get exercise and enjoy yourself. The hotel is very well maintained and a delightful find.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful getaway”
Reviews.Author: bobsarav
Reviews.Content: Check in and check out was quick, efficent, friendly. Room was nice size, clean, nicely decorated, great view of bay and dock. Food and drinks at bar and restaurant were very good. Breakfast was excellent. All personnel were very nice and friendly. We had a great time and will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: nutritiondr
Reviews.Content: This trip was with my wife and two sons, age 8 and 3. Our original room face the parking lot with a diagonal view of the bay. They were very accomodating in moving us to both a marina view and a room close to the main elevator (since I knew several nights I would be carrying at least one of the boys in). The room was a good size with thwo queen beds, bathroom with tub, sink and mirror separate, a refrigerator (we did not request it...I don't know if every room has one), and a flat screen television. There was free wifi, too. The complementary breakfast was a wonderful surprise. In addition to the the continental basics, there was a hot line. The hot food changed from day to day, but there was always a potatoe dish (home fries or hash browns), a meat dish (bacon, sauage, corned beef hash), two egg dishes (always a plain scrambled egg and another), and a bread dish like pancakes or french toast. The staff was very nice, but we had little cause to interact with them as we had no issues. They have a laundry facility that takes quarters and they keep a healthy stock of them at the front desk. This was helpful allowing us to pack less. I gave it five stars across the board as we will definitely stay here again if we come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good people, good food, great value”
Reviews.Author: dbefus
Reviews.Content: We booked the Bay Club from internet and were hoping for the best. From the time we arrived to check out time, our expectations were met. This is not a five star hotel due to age but it was clean and well maintained. They did have five star people who made us feel welcome and comfortable for our entire stay

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT LOCATION FOR AIRPORT AND CRUISE”
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but with a good ambivalence and kept in great shape . Great views either side and a better than average hot breakfast. Excellent pickup at airport and delivery to the cruise port(complimentary). Rooms were more than adequate and clean. Had Thanksgiving dinner there and it was not only reasonably but very good. Staff was very polite and accommodating. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Spotless, Luxurious, and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Gerintell
Reviews.Content: You could not find a better deal than the Bay Club Hotel & Marina. I am writing this review after my first nights stay (of two nights) and so far it's been absolutely perfect. The rate was low and our room has not one but two large hd televisions (accompanied by many hd channels.) Furthermore, the nights were absolutely silent as the location is a few blocks removed from the main drags nearby - not so far removed that one can't take a 3 minute drive to food and supplies, however. The rooms also have mini-fridges which were quite helpful for storing some of our food and drinks we brought with us. Heating, air conditioning, you name it - these rooms have it pretty much. So overall, I would certainly recommend this to any traveler looking for a great value in their hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Olefox
Reviews.Content: Grfeat location, service was fantastic. The free full breakfast was a great way to start the day. Nice view of the bay from our rooms topped it all off. Paying for parking was a bit of a downer. All in all I would recommend this to hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for stay in SD”
Reviews.Author: Red_Admiral_R06
Reviews.Content: Well furnished and equipped rooms, pleaseant staff except for one young girl serving breakfast who did'nt take kindly to being told that I hadn't finished yet so slammed my juice back down on the table. Ten out of Ten for Tim the duty manager when I arrived, thanks mate, you really helped me after a long trip from the UK. Good breakfast included as well. The only downside, which was outside the control of the hotel, was weekend flying out of the U.S. Naval Base over the bay during the weekend which was noisy Would I stay again, can't wait !!

Reviews.Title: “great location for seeing SanDiego,Zoo,Hollywood,LaJolla”
Reviews.Author: suebatts
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at if you are visiting the Zoo, and the other sghts. We even took a day trip to Hollywood. The breakfasts were wonderful - many hot choices with a 'specialty' dish each day so there was no trouble eating there every day for a week. The morning waiter was excellent. Very clean. Nice boardwalk right ouside the hotel for a morning stroll. The only problem was poor internet connec tion. that was frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: amthyst
Reviews.Content: The service that was provided by this hotel was outstanding. Whatever we needed, there was always someone there to help us out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: onvacation123
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. We chose to stay on the "bayside" and had a great view of ships etc coming and going. Awesome hot breakfast was included, we loved the variety of options and the restaurant staff was top notch! Although it was quiet and made you feel like you were away from the busyness, everything we wanted to do and see was a short drive. It is well maintained with great guest service. This would be our first choice if we are back in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in SD, definitely hidden!!”
Reviews.Author: Justinssvc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Bay Club for a week for work. I was upgraded to an executive suite for free and my rate was only $99/night! Parking was $5, but the rate also included free wifi and also a great buffet style hot/cold breakfast in the morning. The rooms were spacious, clean, comfortable beds. Coffee maker and coffee in the morning too. Nice LCD tv with HD channels. Showers were hot with good pressure. Cannot complain. The area is about 5-6 miles from the downtown area, so it is not much to get down there at all. The area is safe on Shelter Island, with a lot of cool little restaurants and pubs near by. I highly recommend for the business traveler as to stay downtown is about 4-5 times the price of this place, and the Bay Club has everything you need.
